lg.l: THEN, to the snowy in thy esteem,
The Father of the Flock a Foe must seem;
The faithful to their yielding Mates.
The chearful which Love and Joy creates,
That reconciles the World by soft Desires,
And tender Thoughts in ev'ry Breast inspires,
To you a hateful Season must appear,
Whilst prevails, and all are here.
Observe the gentle Murmurs of that
And see, how billing she confirms her Love!
For this, the displays her Throat,
And is all her Ev'ning Note.
The very have their tender Hours,
And prouder bow beneath Pow'rs.

And tell their Passions to the gath'ring Air.
Which, had but Love o'er Thee the least Command,
